What is the purpose of the `getreservedeposits` command in Verus?

The `getreservedeposits` command returns all deposits under the control of a specified currency or chain. This includes deposits controlled by an external system or chain, which are only under the control of that system or chain, not its individual currencies.

getreservedeposits "currencyname" (returnutxos)

Returns all deposits under control of the specified currency or chain. If the currency is of an external system
or chain, all deposits will be under the control of that system or chain only, not its independent currencies.

Arguments
1. "currencyname"    (string, required)    full name or i-ID of controlling currency
2. "returnutxos"    (bool, optional)     if true, returns a UTXO list and currency values on each

Result:
 {
   "utxos" : {utxo and currency values},    if returnutxos == true, else null
   "currency 1 i-address" : value,
   "currency 2 i-address" : value,
 }

Examples:
> verus getreservedeposits "currencyname"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreservedeposits", "params": ["currencyname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getreservedeposits
What arguments are required to use the `getreservedeposits` command?

The `getreservedeposits` command requires at least one argument: the full name or i-ID of the controlling currency. An optional second argument, `returnutxos`, can be set to `true` to return a UTXO list and currency values on each.

getreservedeposits "currencyname" (returnutxos)

Returns all deposits under control of the specified currency or chain. If the currency is of an external system
or chain, all deposits will be under the control of that system or chain only, not its independent currencies.

Arguments

2. "returnutxos"    (bool, optional)     if true, returns a UTXO list and currency values on each

   "currency 1 i-address" : value,

 }

What is the difference in the output of `getreservedeposits` depending on the `returnutxos` argument?

If `returnutxos` is set to `true`, the output of `getreservedeposits` will include a UTXO list and currency values on each. If `returnutxos` is not specified or set to `false`, the output will not include this information.

getreservedeposits "currencyname" (returnutxos)

How can I use the `getreservedeposits` command to retrieve deposits for a specific currency using the Verus CLI?

You can use the `getreservedeposits` command to retrieve deposits for a specific currency by running the following command in the Verus CLI:
```
verus getreservedeposits "currencyname"
```
Replace `"currencyname"` with the full name or i-ID of the controlling currency.

getreservedeposits "currencyname" (returnutxos)

Returns all deposits under control of the specified currency or chain. If the currency is of an external system
or chain, all deposits will be under the control of that system or chain only, not its independent currencies.

Arguments

How can I use the `getreservedeposits` command to retrieve deposits for a specific currency using cURL?

You can use the `getreservedeposits` command to retrieve deposits for a specific currency by running the following cURL command:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreservedeposits", "params": ["currencyname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace `"myusername"` with your Verus username and `"currencyname"` with the full name or i-ID of the controlling currency.
